channel.title: Assassins Creed: Revelations
channel.description:
Alright, so I'm surprised that I have't seen ONE thread on Assassins Cred or I haven't been paying much attention (which I haven't), so I'm going to make one, I know a lot of people are psyched up about BF3 but after me getting on the demo, I was thinking how the Hell people could love this game so much! So I deleted that damn thing as soon as possible before it infected the rest of the games (kidding...). Anyway, back on to the point:
[center][b]Assassins Creed: Revelations[/b][/center] I tell you what, I have never been disappointed with a single one of the Assassins Creed games except for the first one, it was the most annoying piece of shit ever! However, after all the updates and things they've done to the game, I haven't been bored of the game yet!
Here are some nice videos of Revelations: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kh0nRRFLJ5k http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8FAGhTqjsCI
And here is a demo of the game: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wmYaouXj7i0
Overall, I think the game will be amazing like the rest of them have so far have been (except the first one, who cares for the first one). The series have not been a disappointment to me and I hope this one won't either, which I'm honestly not worried about!
Discuss.

item.title: Assassins Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:21, topic:418003”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=520550.msg3782608#msg3782608 date=1318625163]

I liked the first one but honestly it was quite boring. The same drill for every single guy you had to kill, the novelty was wearing off after a while. I liked the rest a lot though@

Yes, I didn’t even purchase the first one and started off with the second one.
[/quote]Same I’ve never played the 1st one, I’m in love with this though.[/quote]
I can’t wait for it to come out, at the moment, uncle is getting Gears of War 3 for me, I’ve heard a lot of different dates for AS: R. What is the real, specific date for the release of it?

Read full topic

item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

I’ve always respected Assassin’s Creed, and I have Brotherhood. Revelations looks pretty day-um awesome compared to what I expected.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassins Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

noobofiyer:

i agree, beta sucks, but get over it its a beta boii. BF3 gonna eat the shit of all the games.

It’s not going to eat the ‘shit’ out of all games, assuming if it does, it will bet set in a different category let’s say Assassins Creed will be set in as far as the best game of the year or something like that, I don’t need a person telling me what is and isn’t a good game because we’re all different hence the reason for the creation of this thread.

Chassy13:

It was a beta. It’s going to be full of glitches and things that aren’t right, they want to fix them, which is why they had a beta. The game was quite balanced besides a few aspects, and if you were good at it then you did well. The game requires more skill than CoD, but that’s my opinion.

Yeah… I know, I might rent BF3 but I don’t plan on purchasing the game because I still feel like it would be a waste of time because of how complex it seemed to me. Nonetheless, it wouldn’t hurt me to at least rent it, because I gave up on the BETA.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassins Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“noobofiyer, post:12, topic:418003”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=520550.msg3781340#msg3781340 date=1318504729]
@All: The multiplayer was terrible to me, I wish the damn story-line was freaking longer because this is one game for the entire series that I LOVE the campaign, and never was let-down. Now, I don’t know after this release if this will be the last Assassins Creed, I’m hoping to find Desmond a full playable character if there was to be another release.

still, BF3 will own.

No, the BETA was fucking terrible and I didn’t understand how people could like a piece of shit like that, but that’s my opinion.
[/quote]

i agree, beta sucks, but get over it its a beta boii. BF3 gonna eat the shit of all the games.[/quote]
No.
OT: Assassins Creed Revelations will be amazing.

Read full topic

dude its amazing honestly brother hood was amazing and the second one, i didnt like it how you had to do mini missions to go to the biggers ones. basically, but, i cant wait for this one it seems that every assassins creed game that comes out there always that big shock for the gamers. ( like myself.) and i really cant wait i think i am getting it the day it comes out cuz i am spoiled. and yeh.

item.title: Assassins Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Chassy13:

Have only played II. I loved the game, but never had the motivation to borrow/buy the others for some reason.

I found Brotherhood to be sort of a let down because of the multiplayer aspect - they could’ve improved upon single player with the time they spent on multiplayer. Multiplayer was fun I admit, there was just too many people who tried to play it as an FPS (come on…) I was partners with one guy and we were very good but the funness dies out especially with the slow matchmaking (and probably now, the low amount of players?)

Read full topic

item.title: Assassins Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

I didn’t even know about Revelations (I guess I didn’t think about another one after Brotherhood!) It looks awesome, and even better than I find out now - because now I don’t have to wait so long

However I’m not sure if I’m going to buy it this time - I’ve been loyal enough to buy AC2 and Brotherhood (Brotherhood the day it was released), but Live is a pain in the ass so I may stick with good ol’ PC torrenting (an extra 2 weeks is okay! Launch day Brotherhood bugs were terrible!)

Read full topic

Overall, I think the game will be amazing like the rest of them have so far have been (except the first one, who cares for the first one). The series have not been a disappointment to me and I hope this one won’t either, which I’m honestly not worried about!
